userInterface
Class ManagerUI

java.lang.Object
  userInterface.ManagerUI

public class ManagerUI
extends java.lang.Object

The ManagerUI class displays the window for a manager. The manager can see the data for a specific day of the restaurant's operation. This includes a list of bills for the day, and the ability to see the entire bill information. This also includes a list of employees that logged in that day and their hours worked. Selectors for the day, month, and year let the manager check data for different dates.

Author:
Kalev Roomann-Kurrik

Constructor Detail

ManagerUI

public ManagerUI()
This is the constructor for the ManagerUI class and is called whenever a new manager window is needed. It generates the window, and displays a list of bills for a date, a list of employees that worked that day, a window for detailed bill info, and the selectors for the date.

Method Detail

getDataForDate

public void getDataForDate(int day,
                           int month,
                           int year)
This method is called whenever one of the date parameters (day, month, year) is changed. The date information is passed to a method in the Manager Account class which then gets the relevant database entries for that particular date and passes them back to this method. When this method gets the list of Bill objects and list of employee names that worked that day, it displays them in the appropriate windows.

Parameters:
day - The day of the date to look up.
month - The month of the date to look up.
year - The year of the date to look up.

showBillData

public void showBillData(Bill theBill)
This method is called whenever a manager clicks on one of the bills from the list of bills for a particular day. The bill data shown is very similar to the display of the bill that a waiter sees for a particular table.

Parameters:
theBill - The bill to show data for.

logout

public void logout()
This method is called whenever a manager clicks on the logout button. It will close the ManagerUI window, and bring back the login window.
